isis.stitle: CAB: DAYCAB AND SLEEPER CAB for ProStar, ProStar Premium, and ProStar Limited Models - REMOVE - CAB

svcsubproc.title: General Procedures for Cab Removal
svcsubproc.para: The removal of the cab from chassis can be performed providing an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture are available. Removal procedures may vary for various models depending on the type of equipment and accessories.

warning.para: When working on, or near a vehicle, the following general precautions should be observed.

item.para: Park the vehicle on a level surface, apply the parking brakes, and always block the wheels.
Stop the engine when working around the vehicle.
Drain the air pressure from all reservoirs before beginning any work on the vehicle.
Never connect or disconnect a hose or line containing pressure; it may whip. Never remove a component or plug, unless you are certain all system pressure has been released.
Never exceed recommended pressures and always wear safety glasses.

Do not attempt to install, remove, disassemble or assemble a component until you have read and thoroughly understand the recommended procedures. Use only the proper tools and observe all precautions pertaining to use of those tools.
Prior to returning the vehicle to service, make certain all components and systems are restored to their proper operating condition.

Always turn the ignition key to the off position before disconnecting any of the antilock wiring or connectors. If the key is not off, the EC-15 controller will record the power interruption as a static fault.

note.para: Refer to the correct sections in the Master Service Manual for the component being removed and replaced.

step1.para: The following steps may be used as a guide.
Block wheels of truck and engage parking brake.
Tilt or remove hood.

warning.para: Always disconnect power source before working on electrical equipment.

step1.para: Disconnect battery ground cable.

warning.para: Allow the engine to cool down before removing the pressure cap from the deaeration tank. Always insulate the cap by wrapping it with a thick, heavy cloth.

To prevent possible injury from scalding water or steam, do not pull the pressure cap off immediately when it has been loosened to the first "notch." Pause momentarily to allow time for excess pressure to release through the overflow tube.

step1.para: Drain cooling system and disconnect heater hose.
Disconnect steering shaft at gear.
Disconnect accelerator linkage and cruise control, if so equipped.
Disconnect electrical connections and ground wire.
Disconnect clutch linkage.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury or possible death , whenever any component is serviced or removed from the air system, be sure the air system is drained.

step1.para: Disconnect brake system (air or hydraulic).

warning.para: Refrigerant must be recovered from the air conditioning system before any components of the system are removed or replaced. Removing components while pressure is in the system may cause personal injury or possibly death.

Do not vent refrigerant into the atmosphere. The use of R-12 is a worldwide environmental concern. Because of the absence of chlorine in the molecular structure of R-134a, the use of R-134a refrigerant will not have any harmful effects on the ozone layer of the atmosphere. Because there is not enough evidence to determine the " greenhouse " effect of R-134a, recycling of R-134a is recommended. Effective November 1995, recovery and recycling of R-134a is required by law.
Always use approved refrigerant recycling equipment when working with R-134a. Federal and state laws require that refrigerant be recovered and recycled to help protect the environment.

step1.para: Disconnect air conditioning lines (if so equipped). Refer to GROUP 16 - CAB in the Master Service Manual for the proper procedure.
Remove shift lever from transmission.
Detach exhaust system from cab if system is vertical type.
Detach any other connections between the cab and frame, if required.
Install cab lifting fixture. Make sure fixture is padded to prevent damage to cab.

note.para: Use an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture when removing the cab from the chassis. Pad the lifting fixture to prevent damage to the cab assembly.

step1.para: Partially lift cab so cab weight will be supported on lifting fixture.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab on Daycab and Sleeper Cab

step1.para:
To remove daycabs, remove cab to frame mounting bolts and nuts at front and rear mounting locations. Refer to Figure 97
for Remove Daycab Front Cab Mounting and Remove Daycab Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting.

To remove short sleeper cabs, remove cab to frame mounting bolts and nuts at front and rear mounting locations. Refer to Figure 98
for Remove Short Sleeper Cab Front Cab Mounting and Remove Short Sleeper Cab Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting.

To remove long sleeper cabs, remove cab to frame mounting bolts and nuts at front and rear mounting locations. Refer to Figure 99
for Remove Long Sleeper Cab Front Cab Mounting and Remove Long Sleeper Cab Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Daycab Front Cab Mounting
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 97 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove two hex nuts (Item 1) with two flat washers (Item 2) from two square head bolts (Item 3) under lower chassis front cab mount support (Item 4), driver side shown. Save hex nuts and flat washers for installation.
Remove front cab mount cap (Item 5) from two square head bolts (Item 3) under front cab mounting insulator (Item 6), driver side shown. Save front cab mount cap for installation.
Pull two square head bolts (Item 3) out of upper front cab mounting bracket (Item 7), driver side shown. Save square head bolts for installation.
Repeat procedure to remove passenger side cab mounting hardware.

figure.caption: Figure 97. Daycab Front Cab Mounting and Daycab Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting

calloutgroup.callout1: 4. LOWER CHASSIS FRONT CAB MOUNT SUPPORT

svcsubproc.title: Remove Daycab Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 97 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove two hex flanged nuts (Item 8) from the two carriage bolts (Item 9) under the top plate of the rear cab air suspension assembly (Item 10).

The two carriage bolts (Item 9) are secured to the cab underbody sill (Item 11) with cab mount retaining clips (Item 12). The carriage bolts will remain with cab underbody sill when cab is lifted off the rear cab air suspension assembly (Item 10).

caution.para: Inspect all cab to frame attaching points to be sure they are disconnected or damage can result.

step1.para: Using an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture, carefully lift cab from chassis. If removing cab from overhead crane, set it on a suitable surface to protect painted surfaces.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Front Cab Mounting Insulator on Daycab and Sleeper Cab with Cab Lifted off Chassis
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 97
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: If it is necessary to replace the front cab mounting insulator (Item 6), driver side shown.
Remove hex flanged nut (Item 13) from hex flanged bolt (Item 14) and remove hex flanged bolt. Save hex flanged nut and hex flanged bolt for installation, unless damaged and being replaced.

Remove front cab mounting insulator (Item 6) from lower chassis front cab mounting support (Item 4), driver side shown. Save front cab mounting insulator for installation, unless damaged and being replaced.
Repeat procedure to remove passenger side front cab mounting insulator.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Front Cab Mounting Insulator on Daycab and Sleeper Cab with Cab Mounted to Chassis
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 97
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: If it is necessary to replace the front cab mounting insulator (Item 6), use a bottle jack between bottom of cab and frame rail to support cab, driver side shown.

Remove two hex nuts (Item 1) with two flat washers (Item 2) from two square head bolts (Item 3) under lower chassis front cab mount support (Item 4), driver side shown. Save hex nuts and flat washers for installation.
Remove front cab mount cap (Item 5) from two square head bolts (Item 3) under front cab mounting insulator (Item 6), driver side shown. Save front cab mount cap for installation.
Remove hex flanged nut (Item 13) from hex flanged bolt (Item 14) and remove hex flanged bolt. Save hex flanged nut and hex flanged bolt for installation, unless damaged and being replaced.

Remove front cab mounting insulator (Item 6) from lower chassis front cab mounting support (Item 4), driver side shown. Save front cab mounting insulator for installation, unless damaged and being replaced.
Repeat procedure to remove passenger side front cab mounting insulator.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Upper Front Cab Mounting Bracket for on Daycab and Sleeper Cab
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 97
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: If it is necessary to replace the upper front cab mounting bracket (Item 7), use a bottle jack between bottom of cab and frame rail to support cab, driver side shown.
Remove four hex flanged bolts (Item 15) from upper front cab mounting bracket (Item 7), driver side shown. Save hex flanged bolts for installation.
Remove upper front cab mounting bracket (Item 7) from under cab, driver side shown. Save front cab mounting bracket for installation, unless damaged and being replaced.
Repeat procedure to remove passenger side upper front cab mounting bracket.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting Carriage Bolts on Daycab
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 97
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once the cab is lifted from the rear cab air suspension assembly (Item 10). The two carriage bolts (Item 9) are secured to the cab underbody sill (Item 11) with cab mount retaining clips (Item 12). The carriage bolts will remain with cab underbody sill when cab is lifted off the rear cab air suspension assembly.
If it is necessary to replace the two carriage bolts (Item 9), you will have to remove the driver bucket seat and passenger bucket seat or fixed passenger seat.

Remove passenger air bucket seat or fixed passenger seat, and driver air bucket seat on Daycab, refer to
SEATS
. For removing passenger air bucket seat, refer to Remove Passenger Air Bucket Seat on Daycab. For removing fixed passenger seat, refer to Remove Fixed Passenger Seat on Daycab. For removing driver air bucket seat, refer to Remove Driver Air Bucket Seat on Daycab.

Remove passenger air bucket seat or fixed passenger seat, and driver air bucket seat on sleeper cab, refer to
SEATS
. For removing passenger air bucket seat, refer to Remove Passenger Air Bucket Seat on Sleeper Cab. For removing fixed passenger seat, refer to Remove Fixed Passenger Seat on Sleeper Cab. For removing driver air bucket seat, refer to Remove Driver Air Bucket Seat on Sleeper Cab.

After the seats have been removed as required. Remove seat belt mounting bolts securing seat belts to cab floor at the rear of the cab. Pull floor mat up to access carriage bolts in cab underbody sill (Item 11), then pull them up and thread them off cab mount retaining clips (Item 12).

note.para: The Rear Cab Air Suspension System shown is built with the crossmember as part of the rear cab air suspension system; it is installed as an assembly at the assembly plant. Refer to (Item 10, Figure 97) .

step1.para: If it is necessary to replace any part of the rear cab air suspension assembly (Item 10) you will have to replace each component separately as they are built into the crossmember.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Short Sleeper Cab Front Cab Mounting
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 98 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove two hex nuts (Item 1) with two flat washers (Item 2) from two square head bolts (Item 3) under lower chassis front cab mount support (Item 4), driver side shown. Save hex nuts and flat washers for installation.
Remove front cab mount cap (Item 5) from two square head bolts (Item 3) under front cab mounting insulator (Item 6), driver side shown. Save front cab mount cap for installation.
Pull two square head bolts (Item 3) out of upper front cab mounting bracket (Item 7), driver side shown. Save square head bolts for installation.
Repeat procedure to remove passenger side cab mounting hardware.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Short Sleeper Cab Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 98
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove two hex flanged bolts (Item 8) from rear cab mounting bracket (Item 9) under rear of cab floor on driver side.
Remove two hex flanged bolts (Item 10) from rear cab mounting bracket (Item 11) under rear of cab floor on passenger side.
Loosen link hex flanged head shoulder bolt (Item 12) with flat washer (Item 13) and remove height control valve linkage (Item 14) from back of cab.

caution.para: Inspect all cab to frame attaching points to be sure they are disconnected or damage can result.

step1.para: Using an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture, carefully lift cab from chassis. If removing cab from overhead crane, set it on a suitable surface to protect painted surfaces.

step1.para: Remove two hex nuts (Item 1) with two flat washers (Item 2) from two square head bolts (Item 3) under lower chassis front cab mount support (Item 4), driver side shown. Save hex nuts and flat washers for installation.
Remove front cab mount cap (Item 5) from two square head bolts (Item 3) under front cab mounting insulator (Item 6), driver side shown. Save front cab mount cap for installation.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Long Sleeper Cab Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 99
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove two hex flanged bolts (Item 8) from rear cab mounting bracket (Item 9) under rear of cab floor on driver side.
Remove two hex flanged bolts (Item 10) from rear cab mounting bracket (Item 11) under rear of cab floor on passenger side.
Loosen link hex flanged head shoulder bolt (Item 12) with flat washer (Item 13) and remove height control valve linkage (Item 14) from back of cab.

caution.para: Inspect all cab to frame attaching points to be sure they are disconnected or damage can result.

step1.para: Using an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture, carefully lift cab from chassis. If removing cab from overhead crane, set it on a suitable surface to protect painted surfaces.
